Header: Former Defence Secretary says President has the power
Content: Former Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa says that the President is vested with the powers to convene the Parliament. He said this to the media after a ceremony near the Ruwanweli Maha Seya in Anuradhapura.Former Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa said that the power to convene the parliament is vested with the President. He said that a UNP President prorogued the parliament for two months. He said that it could be used for stability in the country or for any other purpose. He further said the President can convene the parliament but it cannot be done by foreign countries or the Ambassadors. He added that the Tamil National Alliance has fractured and some of them who love the country and the Tamil people will join with Prime Minster Mahinda Rajapaksa. Ruwanweli Se Siyapath Wandana religious ceremony was held under the patronage of former Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa. It has been organized to invoke merits on the heroic soldiers who sacrificed their lives to the country. The religious ceremony was held under the guidance of Chief Monk of Atamasthanaya Venerable Dr. Pallegama Siri Niwasa Thera and under the patronage of the Registrar of Ruwanweli Maha Seya Pallegama Hemarathana Thera. The Maha Sangha, Heads of Security Forces and a large group of people attended the ceremony.
